samples.context: Good health is a very hard thing to measure, but it is one of life's most precious things. The World Health Organisation has defined health as a state of complete physical, mental and social well-being.
samples.question: How does the WHO define health?

samples.context: Community health can be defined as 'All the personal health along with the environmental services for the importance of health of community'.
samples.question: What is community health?

samples.context: Some of the health services are given below: (i) Establishment of health care services like primary health centers, district hospitals, community health centers, medical colleges, all Indian institutes, regional hospitals etc.
samples.question: What are examples of health care services?

samples.context: (ii) Provision of safe drinking water and proper disposal of garbage. (iii) Prevention of harmful insect breeding sites.
samples.question: What does community health include?

samples.context: (iv) Management of different types of environmental pollution by Central and State Pollution Control Boards.
samples.question: Who manages environmental pollution?

samples.context: (v) Preventive vaccinations against number of diseases like tuberculosis, diphtheria, whooping cough, tetanus, measles, hepatitis, etc.
samples.question: What is the purpose of preventive vaccinations?

samples.context: (vi) Provision of family planning advices and services. (vii) Provision of medical care to school going children.
samples.question: What services are provided to children in communities?

samples.context: (viii) Prevention of food adulteration. (ix) Health education.
samples.question: What are other significant health services offered?
